Comment: Un contexte intÃ©ressant et qui permet d'appliquer des concepts basique de la programmation pour rÃ©soudre le problÃ¨me.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: I like it

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: it is clear and able to be done in a short amount of time
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!

*Goal section:

   - change your "However, to" explaining section to the below:
         Creating a tower cost the energy same as its hight
         Destroying a tower gives you the same energy as its hight

*Input section:

    - Can you please change the input section's input Constraints(E.G. Line 1- An integer N (1 â‰¤ N â‰¤ 10^4), the number of actions to perform.) to the constraints section, so it would turn into <<Line 1>>: An integer [[N]] for the number of actions to preform, and the constraints section would be 1 â‰¤ N â‰¤ 10^4? That would make it easier to read, but I didn't see 5DN1L mention that.

   - can you make Line 2 to => <<Next [[N]] lines>>: the action to preform, and then move the explaining for [[A]] to the goal section?


*Constraints section:

   - Can you move your current constraints section to the goal section as it is not really an constraint?

*Test case section:
   - I think you should add some test cases where the energy left is an positive number, and one for when the energy left is 0



- Please also to remember use the [[variable fortmat]] if you are using an variable(such as mentioning [[A]] in your goal section, ect)
- Also read and change the suggestions 5DN1L makes!


Overall, I think this would be a really cool puzzle to do! Once you fix these and the things pointed out by 5DN1L, it should be ready! I am looking forward to seeing it in action!

P.S. someone tell codinGame to support tab in comments ðŸ’€

Input section
* Please follow the example in the contribution guidelines in presenting this section:
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement#guidelines
In particular,
* Line numbers are formatted in <<bold>>.
* Constraints should be moved to Constraints section.
* Explanation should be moved to Goal section.
* Variables should be formatted using [[this_syntax]].

Hence, suggest to change this section as:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of actions to perform.
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> An integer [[A]] for an action.

* Then format the variables in the two inequalities, and move the inequalities to Constraints section.

* Also format the variables in the explanations (If A is positive... If A is negative...) and move the explanations to Goal section.

Output section
* Please format the line number in <<bold>>.

Cases
* Each pair of test and validator should be SIMILAR but DIFFERENT. Please revise the cases.

Thanks.

Hello World ! It's my first contribution, i take all tips for improve my exercise.


Thanx !
Thanx for details feedback, i take note of your comment and fix it asap

Energy can only be positive if
either: the magician-developer starts with a positive energy (but here the assumption is that the starting energy is 0),
or: the magican-developer can magically destroy non-existent towers (or maybe those towers were created by somebody else?).

Otherwise, it seems that energy can at best be zero under the current settings.
Thanx for feedback maybe i try other contribution later
Merci de ton retour qui permet la validation,  Ambassadeur de "l'ami codeur" :D

Hello @5DN1L thanx for have helping me, i think i fix what you tips me but i dont understand for this section case, have you one exemple testX/validatorX for understant logic and direction for other ?

Hello! You may refer to the explanation here:
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/test-cases#guidelines

Basically you would want each pair to test similar situations.

Actually, I don't understand why going into negative energy is allowed. If you disallow that, then it's easier to define different pairs, e.g. pair 1 is about having sufficient energy without ever going into negative, pair 2 is about having just enough energy, pair 3 is about not having enough energy midway, and so on.

If you still need to understand more about tests and validators, please let me know.

Thanks for making the changes. Just a few more fixes:

Goal section
* Please fix the typo: "hight" => "height" (2 times)

Constraints section
* Please delete "N should satisfy the inequality".

* Please delete "Each integer A should satisfy the inequality".

Thanks.
